title: high ping whenever games routes through "telia" severs on network path

replies.body:
Your traceroute definitely shows some issue along the Telia nodes in your route. Since your network routing to a server is determined by your ISP and the backbone providers it partners with, I recommend reaching out to their tier 2 tech support with this traceroute so they can investigate. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=7J60gQP5,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-09-11T23:17:37.476+0000)
>
> Your traceroute definitely shows some issue along the Telia nodes in your route. Since your network routing to a server is determined by your ISP and the backbone providers it partners with, I recommend reaching out to their tier 2 tech support with this traceroute so they can investigate. 
> 
> Let me know if you have any questions.
 been there done that
Thank you for your email and allowing me the opportunity to assist.
 
I reached out to our Network engineers and discussed this with them. Suddenlink "hands off" at hop 6 to hop 7, at which point it is off the Suddenlink network to Telia. Two hops into Telia's network is fine; however, In hop 9 where Telia hands off to Riot games is where the high ping time occurs:
 
8 39 ms 39 ms 39 ms dls-b21-link.telia.net [62.115.138.200]
9 246 ms 244 ms 237 ms riot-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.telia.net [62.115.63.70]
 
The trace is showing that the lantecy starts on the link between Telia and Riot, far off of the Suddenlink network. I recommend getting back with Riot and seeing if they can contact Telia to further investigate this for you.
 
Thank you for choosing Suddenlink.  If you have any further questions, you may contact us Monday - Friday 8am to 10pm or 9am to 6pm on Saturday and Sunday via our online chat at http://www.suddenlink.com/contact-us/#tabs-3 or by phone at 1-888-822-5151.  We are available to assist you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, by phone.

Thank you,

Kacie P.
Suddenlink Customer Support

Unfortunately, because your ISP partners with Telia in order to route your connection to the server, your ISP will need to reach out to Telia's network engineers to resolve this. Backbone providers aren't always too keen on working with us because we aren't directly or indirectly their customer.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=7J60gQP5,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-09-12T15:44:43.699+0000)
>
> Unfortunately, because your ISP partners with Telia in order to route your connection to the server, your ISP will need to reach out to Telia's network engineers to resolve this. Backbone providers aren't always too keen on working with us because we aren't directly or indirectly their customer.
> 
> Let me know if you have any other questions.



Let's help Targons Blade do some basic networking since he is having a hard time. The IP 104.160.131.1 is allocated to Riot according to arin.net. Ignoring the rDNS of hop 9 in Swiftkitten's trace that shows Telia and Riot in one line indicating a direct peer, let's look at the BGP AS path. Telia has a looking glass at looking-glass.telia.net and performing a BGP lookup on 104.160.131.1 shows a single AS path of **AS6507**, which if you also put into arin.net shows up as Riot. An AS (ASN) is an identification for a collection of prefixes under the control of one operator such as Telia (AS1299) or Riot (AS6507). All of these facts prove that Riot directly peers with Telia. Has Riot also reached out to Telia since the trace from Swiftkitten clearly shows the latency starts between hop 8 and 9? 

Now, in all fairness, since traces only show one path (from source to destination), the return path from Riot back to Swift could show a completely different picture but since Riot has taken a hard "it's not us" stance and has not actually done anything to help, that information appears to be held hostage. 

9 246 ms 244 ms 237 ms **riot**-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.**telia**.net [62.115.63.70]

> [{quoted}](name=IS17d1078bfb673366dcde2,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=7J60gQP5,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-15T22:22:04.495+0000)

Ignoring the rDNS of hop 9 in Swiftkitten's trace that shows Telia and Riot in one line indicating a direct peer, let's look at the BGP AS path. Telia has a looking glass at looking-glass.telia.net and performing a BGP lookup on 104.160.131.1 shows a single AS path of **AS6507**, which if you also put into arin.net shows up as Riot. An AS (ASN) is an identification for a collection of prefixes under the control of one operator such as Telia (AS1299) or Riot (AS6507). All of these facts prove that Riot directly peers with Telia. Has Riot also reached out to Telia since the trace from Swiftkitten clearly shows the latency starts between hop 8 and 9? 
> 
> Now, in all fairness, since traces only show on path (from source to destination), the return path from Riot back to Swift could show a completely different picture but since Riot has taken a hard "it's not us" stance and has not actually done anything to help, that information appears to be held hostage.

that's basic?

well i got a 

> support rep: It has been a pleasure assisting you today. Thank you for choosing Suddenlink Online Support.
> me: 10/10 for service
> support rep: I hope you have a great night on the Rift. Remember, everyone hates Teemo.
> me: XD omg i love you
> support rep: :D Have a great night and best of luck. We will get the ping resolved. 


specifically: 

> We will get the ping resolved.

so hopefully that didn't come with a hidden "Soon TM"

well after hearing "we cant fix it its not our end" from email support on suddenlink about 8 times.. i got a live chat and he told me he would send out a technician in person tomorrow.. who would (in person) verify my trace route  and reroute it for me.

so hopefully soon..

update....
 any reason why its doing THIS? i see absolutely no reason for it to go to Switzerland... when i need to go to California from Arizona

what is the point of playing on the NA servers if i am being routed to Switzerland?
